datafield.subfield: Ḥanafī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr,
Khizānat al-fatāwá wa-maʻahu Lisān al-ḥukkām li-Ibn al-Shiḥnah,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 551

Origin: As appears in colophon (fol.221a-b), copying finished ("katabahu...qad waqaʻa al-ikhtitām") by Ibn Muṣṭafá al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Zaghrawī al-ʻAtīqī, known as nāʼib Ḥalabī on Friday the ninth tenth of the first third of the fifth sixth of the first half of the eighth tenth of the eighth tenth after one thousand of the Hijrah = Friday, the ninth of Jumādá I 1078 / ca. 27 October 1667.
Accompanying materials: a. Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas. -- b. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda
Former shelfmark: From front inner cover "IL 109a" (likely supplied by Yahuda) ; from second front flyleaf "B. I. 373 II. 97".

Binding: Pasteboards covered dark purple straight-grained leather ; Type II binding (with flap), two-piece binding (seam of overlapping flanges visible at spine) ; pastedowns and flyleaves in emerald green coated wove paper ; upper and lower covers carry faded, gold-painted floral spray filling central rectangular panel, as well as tooled and gold-painted borders ; sewn in dark blue thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in white and magenta over yellow primaries ; overall in fairly good condition with minor abrasion, etc.

Support: European paper of several different types ; one type with roughly 7 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 26-28 mm. apart (vertical), watermark of crown-star-crescent (70 mm. long, parallel to chains, compare Mošin and Grozdanovic-Pajié type V. A., see p.20, 72, 438, etc.), and countermark "V d" under trefoil (see p.82, etc.) ; another, slightly thinner type with 11 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 28 mm. apart (vertical), watermark of three hats (tre cappelli, see p.18, etc.) and countermark of "P A" under trefoil (see p.14, 36, 64, etc.) ; a few other countermarks visible as well ; all well-burnished.
Decoration: Section headings, notabilia (side-heads, such as "مطلب"), and overlining rubricated ; textual dividers in the form of three dots.

Script: Naskh-nastaʻlīq (talik) ; small, compact hand in a medium line (same hand supplying both works) ; serifless with slight effect of words descending to baseline, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, some elongation of horizontal strokes, letteforms characteristic of nastaʻlīq, point of final or free-standing nūn often either conjoined with bowl or set down within.
Layout: Written in 31 lines per page.

Collation: ii, I (2), 12 V (122), III (128), V (138), IV+1 (147), 7 V (217), II+1 (222), ii ; chiefly quinions ; catchwords present ; each work foliated in red Hindu-Arabic numerals (upper left corner of recto for each folio beginning from the folio following the incipit page) ; pagination added later in pencil.

Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, "حمدا لك اللهم على ما منحت لي من التكميل والاختتام وصلوة على من حث عبادك على التعلم والتعليم والاعلام حيث قال العلماء ورثة الانبياء العظام خصوصا في احاديث الاخر بقوله عليه السلام ... كتبه الفقير الى رحمة ربه القدير ابن مصطفى الشيخ محمد الزغروي العتيقي الشهير بنائب حلبي في البلدان وبابن ميرالآي في الاوطان اللهم اغفر لي ولوالدي ولمن علمنا ولمن علمهم ولمن قال به امين لمن دعا لمصنفه ولكاتبه واجعلهم في الدارين ... قد وقع الاختتام في يوم الجمعة وهو العشر التاسع من الثلث الاول من السدس الخامس من النصف الاول من العشر الثامن من العشر الثامن بعد الالف من هجرة من له العز والشرف"
Explicit: "ولو طلب كافر من مسلم ان يعلمه القران والفقه فلا بائس به رجاء على ان يطلع على محاسنه فيسلم كذا ذكر في التحفة والله تعالى الموفق الى السبيل الراشد واليه المرجع والمأب"

Incipit: "الحمد لله حمدا بعدد ما اظهر من معدن الازن بو اقبت [?] ودررا...و بعد فان العبد الضعيف احمد بن محمد بن ابي بكر خصته الله ترفاته واسلافه برحمته يقول لما فرغت من تسويد مجمع الفتاوى الذي جمعت في كتب العلماء العظام والمشايخ الكرام الولها فتاوى الكبرى والصغرى للصدر الشهيد..."
3. fol.126b-fol.222b : Lisān al-ḥukkam fī maʻrifat al-aḥkām / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad Ibn al-Shiḥnah ; Burhān al-Dīn Ibrāhīm al-Khāliʻī al-ʻAdawī.
1. fol.1a-fol.125b : Khizānat al-fatāwā / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Ḥanafī.
Mošin, Vladimir and M. Grozdanovic-Pajié. “Das Wasserzeichen ‘Krone mit Stern und Halbmond.’” Papiergeschichte 13 (1963):

[1] Khizānat al-fatāwā, a compendium of legal decisions; followed by [2] Lisān al-ḥukkām fī maʻrifat al-aḥkām of Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad Abū al-Walīd Ibn al-Shiḥnah al-Ḥalabī (d. 882/1477), a legal treatise in 30 chapters of which only 21 are included in this copy, and which were begun by Ibn al-Shiḥnah and completed by Burhān al-Dīn Ibrāhīm al-Khāliʻī [or al-Khālifī] al-ʻAdawī in 1027/1618. Each work is preceded by a table of contents. Extensive marginal commentary and reading notes.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Many faded ownership statements and reading notes on fol. 1a including oval seal impression "احمد ...؟" ; marks of collation reading "بلغ" in red (now appearing mainly in first few folios, elsewhere possibly lost to trimming) ; extensive marginal notes on fol. 126a and fol.221a-222b, some with attribution.
خزانة الفتاوى ومعه لسان الحكام لابن الشحنة,
حنفي, احمد بن محمد بن ابي بكر.
